reviews.sentence: Disappointing. There was a hole in the ceiling in the room and mold on the ceiling in the bathroom. The room wreaked of Lysol very strongly upon entrance into the room. The room had a very outdated décor curtains furniture TV lighting. The power cord to the TV was ran out of the front of the stand around the side and plugged into a wall outlet that had no cover on it. The carpet needed steam cleaning. I did have hot water and the water pressure of the shower was nice. Best feature of the hotel besides the price of the room. Definitely a you get what you pay for hotel.
HBO. No fridge. Old TV with bad signal. Location not as good as I thought it was going to be.

A Decent Stay for Decent Value. My mother and I stayed here overnight just to get out of the house. My room was very clean beds linen and towels but was quite cold when we arrived as someone had turned the fan on. It took about 2 hours to get the room comfortably warm. The decor was slightly outdated but there were no visible issues to complain about. Best of all the hotel staff offered fast check in out with a smile.

Do not stay here. We stayed at the Corktown while we were in town to see Garth Brooks. Driving into the Corktown area we were immediately apprehensive as the area is not what is depicted online. There are a few newer bars in the area but it is mostly run down grafiti covered buildings. We arrived at the hotel and it looked pretty deserted except for the man leaning against the building drinking a beer. We sat in the parking lot calling other hotels and there were none available because there were back to back concerts that evening. At this point we had no choice except to stay. We went to the front door and had to wait for someone to buzz us in. They have tried to dress up the lobby with large lighting fixtures but nothing can distract you from the bullet proof glass completely surrounding the front desk with a small slot to pass your credit card through or the distinct aroma of marijuana in the air. We checked into the first room small dirty disgusting with stained sheets and the paint was peeling off the walls the toilet did not flush and the walls so thin you could hear neighbors on both sides talking. I called the front desk to complain and they moved us to a king room. The room was larger but still dirty. The walls were stained and the paint was peeling the sheets looked clean but the box spring no bedskirt had huge stains of some sort. We continued to call other hotels with no availability. We decided to make the best of it got ready and called for a taxi. While in the lobby waiting for a taxi three other couples checked in went to their rooms and checked back out. One lady stated there was something resembling feces smeared in her carpet and part of someones weave in the closet. We had a fantastic time at the concert. it is a short taxi drive to downtown however when we returned we had to wait outside for the on duty manager to buzz us in because the card reader at the door was broken. This is not an area you want to be standing around outside at 2AM. I read reviews on this hotel prior to booking it and can only think the positive reviews are completely bogus. Worst place to stay ever.
The bed and location. Dirty towels in bath room. Dirty toilet had to ripe off toilet. No ice bucket. and more.

corktown. We booked a room with a jacuzi tub but did not use it because of lack of hot water. That was a bummer. Everything else was great especially the housekeeping lady. She was really nice give her a raise.

Worst hotel experience. My husband and I visited this hotel on the night of June 27th to go to Comerica park the next day. The hotel is dingy and old on the outside and you should expect the same for your room. The receptionist working was behind bullet proof glass already a bad sign and the lobby smelled like mildew and cigarettes. We thought we had give the room a chance though so we got our keys and drove around to the secure parking. It took us 10 minutes to get our key to open up the security gate and there was extremely suspitious activity going on in the parking lot while we were trying to figure it out. This hotel is located in a terrible neighborhood and I felt very unsafe. At this point I just wanted to get to the room and lock the door behind me. Once we got up to our room the smell was no better the bed spread was dirty and the plaster was cracking off the walls. Also the TV did not work the bathroom was filthy and old with missing tiles in the walls and floor. The air conditioning unit in the room made a very loud clanging noise about every 30 seconds to a minute that I do not think anyone could sleep through. After taking a look around the room we decided that we absolutely could not stay in this disgusting place. We took the keys back to the front desk and told the woman working that we would be checking out. Her unphased demeanor by us leaving shortly after arriving seems to suggest that this is a common occurrence. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

As a frugal traveler I have been to a lot of budget hotels and this is one of the best I have been to for this kind of price. I have to admit kind of funny when ALL our friends in town for the same event stayed at fancy places and had all sorts of complaints. Check in and checkout were extremely quick and painless the free. gated parking was a fantastic bonus and the staff we encountered were nothing but sweet and polite. As our fan convention was going on a block away the lady running the front desk even had Japanese music quietly playing in the lobby. It was such a simple but thoughtful touch and I really wish I had taken note of her name. That one little gesture did a lot to get us in the mood for a fantastic weekend. I suppose if I had to come up with a downside it would be the lack of frills but that is to be expected for a place within this price tier. Rooms do not automatically come with refrigerators or other appliances but coffee is made in the lobby every morning and the rooms have ice buckets. Wi Fi is free which is wonderful considering a lot of five star places do not even give you that. Surveillance definitely seemed like a priority so even as sheltered suburbanites my partner and I never felt like we or our car were unsafe during our stay. Our room was clean and everything worked without a problem so I have no real complaints. If you are just looking for a simple place to rest at night without anything fancy I had highly recommend the Corktown Hotel. My companion and I have every intention of returning next year. Edit. As much as I try to be respectful I have to admit I am confused about all the bullet proof glass complaints. Guys. it is downtown Detroit and the staff have every right to their safety. Get over yourselves.

Great staff Poor room. Staff was great. Very friendly and acknowledged visitors as they approached. I am ok with old carpet and paint in the hallways. I am ok with running the shower for 3 mins to get it hot. But it was a bummer to find fingers nails on the hotel room floor and dirty linen on the bed.

The hotel from hell. The place was a dumpIt had the feel of a sleazy motel the beverage machine was dispensing warm beverages the noise coming from the other rooms all night fighting it was a horrible stay one iron in the whole place no ironing board. Not enough outlets to plug in iron. the front desk was a table set up in the hallway it smelled like mildew and it did not feel safe the pictures are very misleading I would not stay there again.

Clean but prison like rooms. The guy at the front was very helpful knowledgeable of the area and genuinely pleasant. The hotel ownership has obviously put money into updating the place in a city that desperately needs it. Unfortunately that is where most of the positive reviews end. The room was updated and very clean but this is still a block building with concrete floors. Concrete floors block wall. metal conduit feeding all lights gave the place a very industrial feel. Maybe this is considered modern and comfortable to some but not to me. It was dorm room comforting at best but honestly it reminded me of a jail cell. That coupled with the surrounding area made for an uncomfortable sleeping experience even though the bed and linens were comfortable and clean. The gated parking is not exactly 6 foot barbed wire fences but it should be. would not be hard for a thief to access. The park was not somewhere you will want to go read a book. Very green and appeared well kept but also at least one homeless or drunk on every park bench. This hotel is really trying in a city that needs more of it but the area is atrocious. Also if your cab driver does not turn on the meter work out a rate with them immediately or they will price gouge you. Happened on my way to and from downtown do not believe the its a set rate BS. This in no way reflected on the review. The overall experience would have been one star but the personable staff and cleanliness made it a 3.
We just loved our stay here. We received a very warm welcome from the staff and our room was great.
This place is fantastic. A true delight for the whole family. The staff is quite friendly and helpful when looking for things to do in Detroit. The beds were great and the courtyard was fantastic.

I LOVED This Place. This place was great. We had gated parking and high class service. Everyone was friendly and accommodated our late check out. The room was clean and comfortable. There was a bathrobe and slippers for us along with a bathtub big enough for my boyfriend and me to both enjoy. it is in a great location right next to everything happening in downtown Detroit. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Friend staff good location industrial chic. We were in town for an event and needed a hotel room for one night not too far from New Center Park. It is difficult to find a hotel in Detroit that is not either overpriced or has horrible reviews. We were happy to find the Trumbull and Porter. Bonus Batch brewing is a block away. The staff was friendly to a person and the dining staff got us in and out quickly while serving delicious food. The hotel is tastefully remodeled with an industrial contemporary vibe. The rooms are small but sufficient with attention to detail in the trimmings. The bed was comfortable and although there was a party in the courtyard we were in the back of the hotel and slept like babies. The hotel and room were clean and well maintained and we would stay here again.

Detroit Gem. This is a fabulous hotel. I was moving to the area and simply was looking online for a hotel that was pet friendly for dogs 25lbs or less — and boy did I get way more than I bargained for. The hotel is impeccable the rooms are nice and roomy the food Red Dun is outstanding the bar is fab and they even have a terrific coffee bar. Even with all this the BEST part is staff. Everyone from housekeeping to the front desk to the servers and bartender are without exception friendly warm service oriented and delightful.

Love this hotel. Try to stay here every time I ’m in Detroit. Favorite hotel in the area. This hotel is doing something different OK go on. it is modern with a little bit of a Euro vibe. The rooms are hip but still comfortable. Bath robes. High quality bedding and pillows. Having the Red Dun restaurant downstairs is a REAL perc. They just got a new chef who is a real artist. Nice fitness center with view of the Ambassador Bridge. We really appreciated the secure gated parking. And the hotel is walking distance from some Detroit is finest new establishments.
Wonderful. Love the Decor and that they keep it Local. Rooms were cute and comfortable. The Bar Restaurant was good. The firepit was nice at night.

Loved it. Trumbull and Porter is a SUPER arty hotel in Corktown Detroit ’s oldest neighborhood. They were extremely accommodating to me and placed me on the 4th floor facing the bridge. The hotels has everything you need fridges in rooms a store really nice breakfast and a restaurant. There is gated parking and the rooms are really perfect. Comfy beds and linens and updated furnishings and great lighting. I LOVED my stay here. And Detroit is a fascinating city.

Charming Detroit Hotel. Awesome Detroit vibes here. Great courtyard area that would be a fantastic place to hang in the summer. there is also a fire pit so I guess it is all season. Fun murals and photographs for decor and walking distance to downtown for a show or sporting event. My only gripe would be that we walked through the front door three separate times and no one ever said hello or welcome even when I was headed to the counter to check in.
